result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony D. Olson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony D. Olson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of probation:

Serve 215 days conditional jail time.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin county that will accept including Dane County.  The Court has no objection to electronic monitoring.  Jail begin time stayed until on or before December 10, 2014 between 6-7 a.m.

Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment and/or programming recommended by the agent.

4 days credit to be applied in the event of revocation.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With huber/work release.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.  Jail stayed until on or before Dec. 10, 2014 between 6-7 a.m.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Anthony D. Olson in court with attorney Steven M. Cohen. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. C states parties are ready to proceed to sentencing on count 1/OWI 4th in exchange for dismissal of counts 2 and 3.  Atty. C states def will be asking for transfer to Dane County with language on JOC "no objection to electronic monitoring."  Counsel jointly ask for probation disposition with conditional jail time, fine/costs, revocation, IID, and AODA.  

Def pleads guilty to OWI 4th.  Court's colloquy re plea.

Counsel address the Court.  Court addresses Def.  

Court accepts plea agreement.  Sentence withheld for 3 years probation with conditions of 215 days in the county jail with 4 days credit; Court has no objection to electronic monitoring (sentence may be served in Dane County).  DA states that, if def requests a stay for jail to be set up in Dane County, stay should be very, very short.  Court has granted a 2-week stay of the jail to allow def to get affairs in order for this to be served in Dane County.  So, jail is stayed until on or before Dec. 10 between 6-7 a.m. Jail may be served in any jail that will accept.  

Further conditions of probation:  no possession/consumption of alcohol with test on demand; AODA/follow through; 36 mo dl revocation; 36 mo IID upon relicensing; attend, successfully complete/pay for any treatments/programming recommended by agent.  DNA sample to be provided.

Felony admonishments provided including lifetime firearm prohibition (includes muzzle loaders).  

$2908 is total on the fine.  Def to pay this to the agent during term of probation.  ($1000 bond has been applied; remainder to be collected by the agent).
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.
request from Atty. Cohen to adjourn the 10/15 status and reschedule it as a plea/sentencing in November; request approved by the Court 9-30-14
Status conference on October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Cohen.  Atty. C states that this matter is close to resolution; asks for further status/possible plea/sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for 10-15-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on August 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Cohen.  Forehand states that today's hearing was on the calendar as a status but it was intended to be a prelim and the State has its witness here, ready to proceed with prelim if that's what the Defense wants.  However, if Def wants a contested prelim, the State's offer is off the table.

In recess while Defense considers options.

Back on the record, Atty. Cohen informs the Court that the Def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Waiver form presented to the Court.  Court conducts prelim waiver colloquy with Def.  Court accepts waiver and binds def over for trial.

ADA states that the offer was for a plea for probation with conditional jail time of no more than 215 days.

Parties request arraignment.  Set for Aug. 20 at 2:30.
Status conference on July 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Cohen.  Atty. Cohen states that he has not received discovery.  Court read the complaint to the def at the last appearance.  Court has informed def of the right to prelim with 20 days of today's date.  Def waives prelim time limits and sets prelim for July 2 at 10.  Status conference scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony D. Olson in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def has received a copy of the complaint. Court reads complaint to def, informing him of charges/max possible penalties. Court informs def of his right to counsel. Def states he has hired counsel and he had another hearing and would be a little late. Court will reschedule this matter for another date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
to those posting cash bond
